intro: Chorizanthe corrugata, commonly known as the corrugated cholla, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its spiny stems and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and desert landscapes. Its leaves are reduced to small, scale-like structures, and it produces seeds that are dispersed by wind. Chorizanthe corrugata is well adapted to survive in harsh, dry conditions with minimal water requirements.
